@PervKnight-sama but 50 Shades wasn't *meant* to be a rape glorified bs story. The author simply never had real experience with BDSM or bondage alone and it shows, hard. By the looks of it, she thought about what bondage is without having any idea of it or looking into the subject and romanticized all kinds of abuse. And further, all the people who like 50 Shades, are the same people like her: people who like the idea of bondage but are probably too scared to try it out for themselves and of course people who also romanticize various kinds of mental illnesses (i.e. depression).
